Reviews.Title: “ok place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jazzSt_Louis
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great, it's in the very center of the city. There is a Starbucks right next door :) The rooms are nice. Very helpful staff. I'm not sure if everybody gets a bottle of champagne upon visit, but I did (it was my birthday). My only complaint is the glass door dividing the bedroom from the bathroom. If you need privacy, this might be a problem :)

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel, not really that high tech though...”
Reviews.Author: Matt C
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night on a transit via MAD. Well decorated rooms and good sized bathroom with a very modern shower. The hotel is in a great area if you want to eat & drink the night away. Free wifi is always a plus as well. Great value for a clean trendy downtown hotel, I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: cbonla
Reviews.Content: The location is very good, central and close by to the station. However, the hotel as such has very very small rooms, you cannot get to the bathroom without waking up the whole room, as there is no actual wall, its all made of glass, although not transparent, when you light up the bathroom, you will wake up whoever is in the room sleeping, which is no great at all. You can close the door of the bathroom either, as there is no locker. Toiletries are cheap. The room is clean though, but there is no view whatsoever. The bed is very hard, and not comfortable. It is a small double bed. You can hear people walking down the stairs or in the corridor. I was waked up by the cleaning lady who was working on the other rooms. The breakfast was really good and had lots of choice, however you need to go early enough, as once most of the people have had their breakfast, there is not much left. All in all, if you are not too fussed by the room itself but happy with the location, you can give it a try. But if you are looking for a romantic gateway, then maybe not.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in the best tourist site”
Reviews.Author: erickMedellin
Reviews.Content: Well located close to the Puerta del sol, the market of San Miguel, plaza mayor, with multiple options of food bars and cafes, comfortable rooms, with Wi-Fi and even laptop, plasma HD TV, in Puerta Del Sol you get easy access to Madrid metro system, that let you get almost every important place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: TatianaFlorida
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at High Tech Petit Palace. The location of the hotel is very convenient, the staff were very helpful, and the price reasonable. Our room was clean and the bed was very comfortable. I also liked the fact that each room has a laptop. I cannot emphasize the great location. It's across the street from Mercado San Miguel and many awesome restaurants and shops. There is so much to see in Madri!!!

Reviews.Title: “Professional Photos are from the day of opening!”
Reviews.Author: Carlota G
Reviews.Content: I love that part of town, but this hotel is really not up to scratch. Room 204 stunk of drains. I was moved to room 404, no drain smell but it was a smooking room, and you could tell! Toiletries are cheap and the shower and furniture couldn't be more worn out... Shame, I really have enjoyed Petit Palace hotels before, but Madrid has way too many hotels in this part of town for me to waste my hard earned money in this one again.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: celticwarrio
Reviews.Content: We booked this for a city centre hotel break for 3 couples and weren't disappointed. We didn't book breakfast as that seemed a little pricey and that proved to be a good decision as there are so many bars and cafes close by offering a whole range of breakfast options at very reasonable cost. The rooms themselves were well appointed and very modern in their decor however the gap in the frosting on the bathroom door was a little bizarre to say the least. As a couple we take a number of city breaks each year and this hotel ticked all the boxes for our requirements - reasonably priced, excellent location ( you can literally walk to all the sites quite comfortably from here) comfy beds and spotless rooms. What more do you want for a city break ?

Reviews.Title: “A nice escape in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This was the first hotel in Spain we stayed in, and we didn't know what to expect. We were pleasantly surprised! The hotel is located right of the Plaza del Sol, so there are many restaurants and shops all around the hotel. We stayed in room 307. It was nice and large with plenty of closet/shelf space for luggage. There was a laptop for web surfing (as well as wi-fi), a TV, an exercise bike and a trouser press. The room was also clean, although not in the very best condition, and the bed was large and comfortable. The view from the balcony overlooked the street below with a great view of street activity and a beautiful church steeple. The bathroom was very nice too, although it seemed that design won over function there. The shower was a capsule shower with UV lights, I believe to help with tanning if that was your choice. We didn't use the tanning option, so I cannot attest to its function, but there was good water pressure, with varying water temperature. It certainly made showering interesting. It seemed that every 20-25 seconds, there would be a burst of burning hot water followed by a burst of icy cold water, and then 20 seconds of warm water. I know when I was in there, I had to keep the shower head focused on the side, and then rinse quickly to avoid getting burned! There was also a clear cut away in the frosted glass bathroom door that didn't allow for much privacy. This wouldn't be a great big deal, but the window was opposite of a mirror, so that we found that there was one small area of the room that didn't have a view on the toilet. This could be uncomfortable if you weren't staying with a spouse or other close family member, but it also allows you a chance to get to know your companions better; hey, everybody poops. One other thing that was annoying, was the light in the hallway. Our room was at the end of the wing, but the sensor that turned the light on was as the far end of the hall. When we walked to the room, the light would turn on, and then by the time we got to our room, turn off. Our key was sort of fickle to unlock the door, so it would take longer than a second, and we would be standing in the dark. Eventually, upon our return, one person would walk around the sensor, while the other unlocked the door. Overall, the hotel was quirky, but I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hi Tech Petit Palace Arenal Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Joyfulbarb
Reviews.Content: I thought this was a very overly-priced hotel, even though it was in an historic section of Madrid. Allegedly, this hotel is on a street that existed in the year One. I say, "big deal!" It cost 150 Eurors, which is quite a lot US Dollars, for a very small room, (I shared with two others), very poorly detailed, old-looking and very inconvenient location, especially pertaining to parking. Driving in downtown Madrid is NOT a good idea anyway. I'd suggest a lower-priced hotel on the outskirts of Madrid, take the metro or bus to the historic section. I didn't choose this hotel; one of my companions did, so I had no choice. I wouldn't have paid even 75 Eurors for this "dump."

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: RdeR76
Reviews.Content: Hotel smells awfull, beds are very hard, room looks old and very poor maintenance... We left after five minutes and looked for another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Petit Palace Arenal”
Reviews.Author: Shannen Y
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a 4 night stay in this hotel. I was a little worried , as I had read various bad reviews... We had a fantastic time. We were greeted by friendly staff and allowed into our room early. The room was lovely, great bathroom and decor. Breakfast was good too, lots of choice. Madrid is an amazing city and if we ever return we will be sure to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, but...”
Reviews.Author: VegardA
Reviews.Content: The location was good, in the middle of everything. However, there was a strange smell in the lobby and the stairs, there was lots of mold in our room and quite some annoying bugs. Service was variable. We will chose another hotel next time we're in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “OK but not the best”
Reviews.Author: hs_prd
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent, about 2 mins walk to Sol metro. Small rooms but that's to be expected in this location. First room they gave me smelt of sewage, which was something of a disappointment (rm 103), but they changed it without fuss and the second one was fine. Airconditioning wasn't working - when I asked they said it was turned off. OK, Madrid in November isn't the same as Madrid in July, but it's still nice to be able to cool the room down if you want to. What was working was the heating, which pumped out hot air all night and made the room almost impossible to sleep in. In the end I switched it off and opened a window, which worked but wasn't ideal especially as there was some sort of walkway directly outside. No laptops in the rooms, which after staying in a couple of other Petit Palaces was a bit of a letdown. Breakfast was excellent. Overall nothing really wrong with this place, but the Petit Palace Mayor is way better in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Our Little Guy”
Reviews.Author: Alana228
Reviews.Content: Great location- we could walk to plaza meyor and puerta de sol as well as the prado and other museums. We thought the room was very small and cramped and bathroom oversized for the size of the room. Loved the balcony and view onto the street. Great to have refreshments when you walked in and throughout the day. Very clean. Laptops were brilliant and the free wifi useful. Most of all, we found the helpful little guy at reception (after 3pm) amazing. He printed off our boarding passes and gave us loads of information about attractions and restaurants. Overall an excellent stay!

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel in center of madrid”
Reviews.Author: brucebana
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel , the rooms are pretty big, sleep up to 4 people with a bunk bed, stay in the higher floor, nicer rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel with all you need”
Reviews.Author: azza11Nz
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel right in the heart if Madrid with easy access on the metro from the train station. We had a quad and triple room. The triple had enough room and was very modern. The quad had a double bed and bunk beds which were comfortable. Each room even has its own laptop to use.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic boutique hotel in central Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Malaga.Spain
Reviews.Content: It´s a small boutique hotel located in the center of Madrid, only 1 minute walk to Sol square. Very modern rooms with A/C, flat TV, confy beds... You have all kind of amenities within walking distance. There is bus, tube and taxis stop within 1 minute walk from the hotel. Highly recommende, very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very busy pedestrian area, middle of everything, hard to negotiate crowds at Christmas.”
Reviews.Author: UTXTraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally located for getting to Plaza Mayor and Sol metro with lots of restaurants and shops surrounding the hotel and an easy walk to the Palace and Opera. You could also walk to Prado and the museum areas, or take the subway from Sol if you didn't want to walk. This was also a drawback in that there were always crowds outside the hotel and sometimes made it hard to get anywhere if you were in a hurry. We had an interior room, so no view, but it was also quiet compared to what it could have been if we had the crowds below our room. The room was well equipped, breakfast was available each morning for 10 euro each with a pretty good buffet. The beds were hard too, so if you don't like that, don't even think about staying here. There was internet in the room both wireless and a hardwired laptop came with the room. I have mixed feelings about the place as to whether to recommend it or not. The location is either good or bad depending on what you are interested in, and the room is OK, but not really up to the 4 star standard they are claiming, though the price is a bit on the low side for a 4 star so it really should be judged more against 3 stars or other hotels in that price range. I'd probably stay close to the Prado if I were looking to pay for a 4 star next time.

Reviews.Title: “abismal customer service”
Reviews.Author: RMcG71
Reviews.Content: We were due to stay on the 29th of September for 4 nights. this was unfortunately the day of the general strike in spain. On the way to the airport we were informed that our flight was cancelled and so went about cancelling the whole trip. the hotel still decided to charge us for the first night as we didn't cancel 48hrs in advance. the situation was obviously out of our control but the hotel showed no understanding. extremely disappointed as we were very much looking forward to staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but noisy”
Reviews.Author: silverseas1
Reviews.Content: We were disappointed with our room as we don't believe that it matched the pictures. The front desk staff were always smiling and helpful, the breakfast, which we had on just one morning of our stay was completely fine - a range of offerings which were tasty and should appeal to most palates. We eventually found a little restaurant just off Plaza del Sol, which sold a great simple breakfast for just a couple of euros. It was under Hotel Europa - highly recommended. The major problem with this hotel is the street noise - until the very small hours of the morning. There is a night club directly opposite and the queues to get in were noisy and constant throughout the nights we were there - probably wouldn't get so bad in the winter! If the windows were double glazed, it would make a great difference. The rooms were inexpensive for a brilliant location in a busy tourist city, so I suppose we got what we paid for. The beds, however, were comfortable and the internet worked in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: sallyzzz
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights when we visited Madrid. Its a very nice hotel for a decent price. Our room was ready upon arrival and when we asked for a higher floor they did not hesitate. the rooms are basic but clean. our bed was two beds pushed together and i think they were all like that. We had a little "balcony" that overlooked the street. it was really nice to just open it for fresh air. it got a bit noisy at night but we didn't mind. the bathroom is clean with all the amenities. the shower was amazing. it was an elephant head shower with other jets. Very cool. the hotel had two computers in the lobby with free internet access which was very convenient Everything is within walking distance of the hotel, so we just walked everywhere. All in all a great trip to madrid :)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: BlackSea
Reviews.Content: We're currently staying in this hotel and are very happy with the location, the quality of the accommodations, the staff's attitude and helpfulness, and everything about this establishment. I don't know where the previous reviewers have stayed because the rooms they describe have nothing in common with the room we have. Our room is very spacious, clean, comfortably sleeps 3 adults, the beds are soft enough, the bedding is nice and smells fresh. The staff are polite and helpful. The breakfast is delicious, with plenty of choices. The bathroom doors are made of glass but, contrary to what the previous reviewers have said, they have no clear spots through which someone can see what goes on in the bathroom. The doors are made of frosted glass which isn't see-through at all. The rooms is brightly lit, the walls and ceilings are white, the only dark color is on the mini-bar and closet door. We would heartily recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Smells and Rooms DO NOT look like the pictures”
Reviews.Author: marasis111
Reviews.Content: This hotel IS in a great location, I will give the previous reviewers that; however, other than that, the hotel is the dumpiest hotel I have potentially ever stayed in. Firstly, the entire hotel smells like wet metal/pipes, the second you walk in - completely rancid. The rooms have very dark wood with purple ceilings which are overall unattractive and the bed is extremely hard and obviously cheap/old. The shower is so small that your body almost touches the walls if you are not careful and I had to open the door in order to shave my legs. The hotel is barely above a hostel and back in college I don't remember some of my hostels even being this reprehensible. I'm 28 and accustomed to nice accommodations at this point in my life, so perhaps it is partially my fault for booking this hotel, but regardless, I don't think the hotel is anywhere near the 100+ Euros we paid/night. I really feel misled by the reviews on this site.

Reviews.Title: “Good breakfast, free internet but bedroom was a bit dark and small”
Reviews.Author: gillyplatt
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a in a great location in the centre of Madrid and very close to the Metro. On the pictures it looks lovely but the bedrooms aren't as nice as they look. It was clean with a comfy bed, but not enough pillows. The room was small, has dark wood furniture and a dark purple ceiling with spotlights in which we found quite oppressive and a bit depressing. Not bright and airy enough. We overlooked a quadrangle of other rooms so not much natural light but at least it was quiet at night. The door to the shower room looks like a shower panel door and is frosted with a clear bit in the middle so not at all private when you go to the toilet. it fits like a shower panel too with a gap all round the outside! We were on the top floor which has 132 stairs to the top! Good if you want some exercise, exhausting if you have walk as the lift is busy, it could only fit 3 people in and there were 4 of us! We asked about breakfast and were given a voucher which was 2 people for 15 euros, the breakfast was great, lots of choice, very helpful lady waitress, coffee not great but ok. The room the breakfast is served in was lovely, they have kept the character well. There were bikes downstairs that were free to use if available, which was good and there is also free internet and free use of 2 computers downstairs in the foyer which we enjoyed using. There are no tea or coffee facilities, if you want a drink you have to go out and buy one! Not good for english tea/coffee drinkers! Starbucks is just a few doors down the road! Staff are bilingual All in all a goodish hotel but we didn't like the rooms very much.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: poligera
Reviews.Content: Location, cleanliness of rooms and breakfast - 10 out of 10. Although we had troubles with heating system - had to change two rooms, as it was broken in both of them! Staff didn't seem mega-helpful or eager - just average. Another problem was smoke coming into our room. We are both non-smokers, so that was annoying. Tasty and plentiful breakfast has made up for other inconveniences though!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, tricky bathroom!”
Reviews.Author: chitowngatorgirl
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were originally supposed to stay at the Petit Palace 'Tres Cruces' location. When we arrived to that hotel we found out that there was a power shortage of some sort and we were being relocated. The frustrating part was the directions were very limited so we wondered for a quite a while. Once we found our new hotel we checked in and were actually happier with this location! The hotel was modern and really centrally located! I couldn't have been happier for the switch. We did ask for restaurant suggestions from the front desk, but really wasn't helped out too much, kinda disappointing. The room was nice and ours was very quite because we were facing an alley on the backside! The only real issue we had was the strange glass cutout in the bathroom door that allowed you to see your friend in all their glory! There were so many mirrors in the room that you really were never safe from being seen in the bathroom. I would stay here again based on the great location alone!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible hotel location for reasonable rates”
Reviews.Author: Rejected
Reviews.Content: Our room had a balcony overlooking a pedestrian street that fit 3 of us comfortably. The staff was great. They held our bags when we checked out for 6 hours at no charge. They recomended a restaurant that was very local and authentic and off the tourist trail. There is a night club accross the street that lets aout around 5am, so you may get woken up if you have a balcony room, but it was well worth it. We did not take advantage of the breakfast, so I can not comment on that. I will book there first on my next trip to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and switch on lousy buffet: be careful!”
Reviews.Author: theaquitaine
Reviews.Content: Overall, a decent hotel in a convenient, but dicey, part of Madrid. We were only staying one night on the way home from a beautiful trip to Sevilla. The hotel was okay -- nothing special. The bathrooms are ridiculous -- be forwarned that the the bathroom doors are glass, and the frosting is incomplete. The showers are also glass, so that my two teenaged daughters had to remain away from the bathroom while their father used the lavatory or shower. Streets were very loud all night -- not unexpected for the Puerta del Sol, but inconvenient if you're a light sleeper. The biggest problem we had was with breakfast. When we came back from lunch and got the key to our rooms (they were not ready when we arrived, so we just left our bags and left for a few hours) the woman who gave us our keys told us there was a free buffet breakfast in the morning. That seemed convenient, as we had an early flight. When we checked out, we were charged 14 EUROS each for the buffet. The only signs for the buffet in the hotel say it is FREE, as did the woman. We had cereal, terrible coffee (from a machine, not even freshly brewed) and some fruit, and they charged us that kind of money. What a ripoff. The woman at the desk looked like she'd been through this drill before -- it's clearly a bait-and-switch they pull regularly. So disappointing. Ruined the last morning of what was a great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “liked the high tech petit palace”
Reviews.Author: hudsonhudson
Reviews.Content: just returned from 3 night stay in the High Tech Petit Palace, location is excellent, staff were friendly rooms were clean but very small, the window in our room was a velux therefore we could not see out the window and had no view. The shower was excellent although the glass door into the bathroom was clear glass. I think it is quite pricey for what you get, but its the location you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Most unfriendly reception staff ever!”
Reviews.Author: DanishgirlSuffolk
Reviews.Content: The best thing going for this hotel is the location, within walking distance of everything you would wish to visit in Madrid. The downsides are the reception staff ( don´t even expect a hola on arrival or the rest of your stay! ) Also don´t book a room unless you are an exhibitionist! For some reason there is a window in the bathroom door to watch your friends on the toilet through ??

Reviews.Title: “Overall Good Experience But Not Perfect”
Reviews.Author: geezer715
Reviews.Content: The property is ideally located near the Plaza Mayor, Plaza del Sol, and the Red Line Metro. It is on a pedistrian walk street and is truly a great central location. The hotel has been recently renovated and is above average overall for a 3 star property. However: there is a HUGE difference in actual rooms. Ours was a "executive/computer" room and was excellent. Lots of space, in room computer with free internet, etc. etc. Friends of ours had a room so small they had to share walking around the bed. They moved out. Also, the hotel is directly accross from the # 1 club in Madrid...which opens at midnight and closes at dawn. Therefore, while a small balcony room seems nice, the noise factor is quite high from midnight to 6 A.M. Request interior/rear if you want to sleep soundly all night. The buffet breakfast at 12 Euro is , at best, OK, - and there are 2 cafes including a Starbucks, within 1/2 block for morning coffee/breakfast. Vast array of bars, shops, and restaurants within a 2 to 3 block radius, including all of Plaza Mayor. The staff was efficient and just OK on the friendliness meter. Caution: there are about 10 HiTech Petit Palace hotels within a 3 mile radius so proceed cautiously to find the best one for your needs..... Overall, we would most probably stay at a Petit Palace very near this one, but try to avoid the noise factor. The location is a massive asset to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Clair77
Reviews.Content: Really impressed with this hotel, great location, just a few minutes from Plaza Mayor. Rooms were modern and clean, whilst still keep old characteristics in the hotel. Great shower/bathroom, the only strange thing was the glass panel in the bathroom door which meant you could see straight through, easily sorted with a large blanket from the wardrobe! Breakfast was extra but also good. Free internet access and safe in bedroom. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Overcharged, and not interested in resolving the dispute”
Reviews.Author: JimBob79001
Reviews.Content: A great location, comfortable hotel with great showers. The hotel however overcharged us for 2 nights and despite various emails do not want anything to do with refunding these charges. Because of this, I would strongly avoid dealing with them again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice option is central location”
Reviews.Author: jlouder
Reviews.Content: Petit Palace on Arenal is in a very good location, even more so because the Calle Arenal was made into a pedestrian street last year. It is a very good shopping street. The rooms on the front have a view of the street and a small balcony. Rooms are in a modern style but pretty small, as is the tiny elevator. The lobby is also very small and narrow, and be warned there are some large travelling groups that stay at this hotel frequently so the lobby can be very backed up. Very spacious breakfast area downstairs, and internet is the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Good Central Choice for Families”
Reviews.Author: 5fortravel
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at 2 other Hi-Tech hotels and this was typical of the chain. The decor is stylish but this particular hotel was a bit more worn than the rest. The rooms were also somewhat smaller but acceptable. The bathroom is "open" to the bedroom so I wouldn't recommend this hotel unless you are traveling with a close companion. We stayed in a family room that had a bunk bed. A perfect choice for a family. Since the location is very central, you can walk out the front door and you are right in the middle of things. That being said, it is imperative to get a room facing the interior. We booked for a very very low rate so we certainly felt we got our money's worth. By the way, the hotel opens into a pedestrian area so if approaching by taxi, they have to drop you off about a block away.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish design!”
Reviews.Author: knabra
Reviews.Content: Stylish rooms with laptop, flatscreen, bubblebath and steamshower. 5 min walk to the placa del sol. Has no restaurant for those who needs it, otherwise perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rosieluvshols
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel in a fab location, very central. The hotel was very clean and the staff very helpfull, booking resturants and cabs. We booked a triple and were given a quad room at the front of the hotel which had a small balcony. Did not have a problem with noise. Would stay here again very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but tatty and very noisy”
Reviews.Author: TravellingGurlUk
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights in March on my own. For a single female traveller it was fine - a good location on a pedestrianised shopping street. I've stayed in other 'hi tech' hotels in Spain so knew what to expect with regard to facilities - but this one was decidedly tatty. The dark veneer that covered most surfaces was chipped and scratched, the glass sink was cracked and the shower leaked. The room was clean, however - and there was a PC and exercise bike in the room. There was a balcony overlooking the street - with a fine view of the nightclub opposite. The first night was quiet. On the second night there was a hoard of loud drunk people outside well into the early hours, and I got very little sleep. The noise was such that in the UK you'd expect the hotel to call the police. The bed (described as a 'queen' in the booking) was 2 singles pushed together. When I complained I was told the hotel was full, and there were no other rooms available. All in all, a disappointment from this usually good chain.

Reviews.Title: “Very hip, modern, cental location.”
Reviews.Author: 1travel5MV
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel with high quality design and a shower to die for. The hotel is very modern, with a classy dark wood meets glass design. The beds were comfortable with a small balcony that opened up to the action of the city below. The lobby is small, but there is a nice internet access room in the back with cool multi colored tiles. The hotel is in an old building, so in areas the old brick walls were left exposed to remind you the hotel always wasn't very modern. Decent staff and very nice rooms and marble bathrooms. Good experience and I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for Sol Area of Madrid but.....”
Reviews.Author: outrun78
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in January at this hotel and got a good deal on the Hotel's website at 75 EUR per night excluding the local IVA rate. Madrid's hotels are quite expensive anyway and as this was one minute walk from Puerta del Sol, this didn't seem too bad a price. Given a room on the 1st floor and asked for a quiet room as having lived in Madrid, I knew this hotel was directly opposite the famous night club Joy Eslava and also the Chocolateria de San Gines, so noise would have been a problem at 5am in the morning. In hindsight I wish I would have asked for the street facing rooms. The room we had on the 1st floor had a tiny window which opened on to an interior courtyard with foul smelling drains which meant of course you dare not open the window. The smell whilst just about tolerable in winter, would in the usual Madrid summer be unbearable. Whilst it was hovering around 0 degrees outsidem, It's such a shame the hotel's air Conditioning system would only blow hot and not cold air to help alleviate the problem. The room was an odd L'shaped affair and very much on the small side, wood floors are actually of the laminate variety and to be honest you get the impression the hotel is trying to be too modern, but the end result is chintz. Shower worked ok, the hydro massage thing is a gimmick. TV had a good range of Spanish Terrestrial stuff, Canal Plus plus CNN in English and TV5 in French. Honesty Minibar Fridge which was nice and appreciated, though curiously no prices displayed in the room. Major faults with this hotel are the drains which I can only imagine in summer would be hell and a serious lack of table space for business people to do any work in the room. A two star hotel at best

Reviews.Title: “Good Value hotel”
Reviews.Author: hardtale
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good value and in the centre of a great city. The accomodation is a little worn, (only a little) but for the price not bad at all. The reception staff spoke excellent english and was most helpful.

Reviews.Title: “To noise”
Reviews.Author: LucaItaly
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ok, is clean, great breakfast with ADSL connection in the room and possibility of using PC in the hall. The location is great, but it's almost impossible to sleep at night since there is a disco in the front, and drunk peolple won't stop shouting untill morning. It's real pity. Next time I will prefer other hotels, since I couldn't sleep at all

Reviews.Title: “Good things and bad things”
Reviews.Author: jplondon
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a good location if you are visiting Madrid for the first time and the rooms are nicely decorated. However, avoid it if you can´t stand noise, as this is one of the busiest areas in Madrid. On top of that, when we visited, there were road works all over the street, starting as early at 6:45am on a Sunday. The decor of the rooms is very modern and in good taste, with free computer and internet access, power shower, etc. Brekfast is basic but varied and staff are helpful. I feel tempted to rate it 4 stars if it weren´t for the fact that the location is so noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Attentive staff; excellent location”
Reviews.Author: philaire
Reviews.Content: This was my family's first stop after 24 hours flying from Australia. We did have a problem initially - our cooling was malfunctioning, but the staff were excellent in handling the situation - they quickly moved us to a better room. As opposed to other reviews, my family found this hotel clean, and the reception area (and its staff) more than adequate, and I would happily recommend to other families.

Reviews.Title: “most central location for an unbelievably cheap price!”
Reviews.Author: Jessica819
Reviews.Content: we paid 50 euros for a room at the petit palace tres cruces but there was something wrong the air conditioning. the petit palace group has hotels in various locations which are very central. we were transferred to arenal, which was minutes away from the famous plaza mayor. the room was a little small, but very stylish, modern and clean. the best thing about the room is the free broadband internet access (providing you have a cable for your laptop) and the modern shower. there are 2 computers in the lobby for those who didn't bring laptops. breakfast was excluded for the rate we paid but there are tons of cafes and bars just a few steps away. the front desk staff were very helpful as well. would definitely stay at petit palace again, the next time i visit madrid!

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: kschrier
Reviews.Content: There have been many hotels during my European travels that don't measure up to the photos online. This was not one of them! The rooms are clean and modern (though the tanning bulbs in the shower are a bit bizarre) and the computer with free internet access was a nice plus. It is located in a busy area that buzzes with noise and voices until dawn, but I will definitely stay here on my next trip to Madrid: the noise is worth the pleasure of coming back to a room you aren't afraid to set anything down in!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: konekel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location, with everything in walking distance or very easily accessible via Metro. We stayed there twice in 2 weeks (at the beginning and end of our Spain trip), and both rooms we had were perfectly nice. The first had an odd shower set-up (which resulted in the floor always getting significantly wet), but that didn't really bother us. The free Internet was nice, and we found the desk staff very helpful with restaurant recommendations, getting us a shuttle to the airport, etc. If you are worried about noise, perhaps request a room with a window on an interior courtyard rather than the street... both rooms we had opened onto courtyards, which were nothing to see but made for a perfectly quiet night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Good Value”
Reviews.Author: wonderfulworld
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights in April and one night in May, 2006. The location is ideal for sightseeing. We had a room on the front facing a busy street with nightclubs that are active until 7:00 a.m. However, the windows are good and blocked out most of the noise. Our rate included a good breakfast--fruit, eggs, meats, cheese, breads, etc. I'm a surpised that some reviewers had such unpleasant experiences.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, just terrible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel on business, and it was the worst one I think I have ever stayed at. The room was tiny, this was supposed to be suitable for four people but it was squashed with just two. The room opened straight onto the corridor with not hall way so the wooden floors kept you awake most of the night. People walking past at all hours we talking in the halls. We tried to check out early although the receptionist said we had to give a months notice!! I have never heard of this before! We had booked the trip through a travel agent and showed them the email we had stating the cancellation procedure. After having taken two days to speak to her manager she finally let us have a refund of the days we had paid. Thankgod we checked out and went to a decent hotel. Beware staying in these hotels, even though they are central they are so noisy and the toilet is just a bit of see through glass in the corner, not for the faint hearted to say the least, even though they are modern there are mirrors everywhere with no space for luggage and your room will never be bright, there just is not enough light for some reason.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Good time, some quirks”
Reviews.Author: mariposalatina24
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Petit Palace from March 23-25. Our stay was okay. The hotel is in an awesome location, blocks away from Plaza Mayor and Sol, as well as Sol Train Station on the 5 Line. Only took us about 30 minutes to get there by Metro from the airport. There are tons of little restaurants and bars to eat. The historic district is within walking distance as well as great shopping. My only complaints were that the day staff at the reception desk was clueless and dismissive. We traveled from the US and arrived at the hotel at 10AM, although i requested early check-in, no rooms were available until 1PM, an hour past check in time. I was a bit annoyed about that. The elevator in the hotel was out of order more times than it actually worked in our short stay. I do think the hotel was a good value. Great location, wonderful buffet breakfast, internet access, which was VERY conveniant and the night staff Angel and Jaime were EXTREMELY helpful and knowledgeable about everything from day trips to walking directions to nearby sights. We loved the showers in the rooms and the mini balcony. If you can, request a room with a balcony, it can get a little noisy at night, but it really gives you a feel for Madrid life.

Reviews.Title: “Not good at all!!!”
Reviews.Author: werly
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews. We booked for 8 of our family. Mum & Dad arrived the night before. After they had checked in, they noticed water coming from the ceiling. They notified reception & were told they had to stay there for the night as there were no other rooms available. In the morning, water had soaked the floors & inside the wardrobes. They moved & were upgraded to a nicer room. Note: the photos they show on their site are for the higher spec rooms & the double rooms are very basic. The rest of the family checked in the next day, reception was rude, off-hand with a couldn't care less attitude. We couldn't get into our rooms as the key cards didn't work, this continued throughout the w/end & we spent a lot of time running back & forth to reception (lift is very slow, got fit running up & down the stairs) Although the hotel is in a good location, we would not recommend a stay here unless you just want a Hostel type service.

Reviews.Title: “A FABULOUS STAY!”
Reviews.Author: SarahLeigh33
Reviews.Content: In my opinion, Petit Palace Arenal is a wonderful hotel with lots to offer. I stayed here in febuary as a birthday treat for my boyfriend and had a lovely time!! The rooms are modern and very comfortable. I can be fussy when it comes to beds but was pleased to see that the double bed had FOUR pillows not two... On arrival, the staff were extremely helpful and welcoming and were quick to offer advice on where to eat and what to see. The breakfast buffet is so delicious and you have so much to chose from its hard to decide what to have! I personally recommend the manchengo cheese and cured hams!!! You couldn't ask for a better location either!!! SOL (metro station) is a 2 minute walk and it only took us half an hour an hour to get to hotel from the airport. We visited the royal palace, real madrid stadium and did lots of shopping. plaza mayor is perfect for drinks in the evening, and we found lot of lovely little tapas places here too! wish i was there now, a FAB few day spent!!! Would definitely return!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel wasn't anything special, but it was so close to the Puerta Del Sol that you couldn't possibly complain. We had the quadruple, which had a double bed and twin bunk beds. The bathrooms are really nice with the "spray you all over" shower heads. We would definitely stay here again. Be careful of pickpocketers, our buddy lost 300 euros a block from the hotel (and it was his birthday too!).

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in the summer for 3 days. We selected because it is one of te very rare European hotels that have rooms for more than two persons. The room was on the back side and so very quiet. Madrid is, after all, a big, noisy city. Everything was modern, worked well and they have a great breakfast buffet. Best of all is the central location. Just about everything on the 'Old Town tourist agenda' was within walking distance. The small quibble with the modern decor was that the bathroom had a clear glass door. Not too good for a family group. We had to tape newspaper over the door for privacy. The hotel is definitely an excellent value for the location and accomodations. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Strian
Reviews.Content: A group of 10 of us stayed for 4 nights at the end of October. The hotel is superbly located for old Madrid - about 150 mtrs down Calle Arenal from Puerto del Sol. Everything you will want to see is within easy walking distance (except the Reine Sofia Arts Centre which is down by Atocha station). The rooms were all good, reasonable size, clean with very modern en suite facilities including a whole-body shower. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful and went out of their way to recommend and book various restaurants for us. They were also interested afterwards in what we thought of the restaurants. They had a 2 for1 offer on brekfast which made if €5 per person - brilliant value - excellent selection of ham, cheese, pastries, fruit as well as cooked ham and eggs. Overall this would be a good value hotel anywhere, but with its convenient central location, it is unbeatable. There are two reasonable tapas bars next door to each other just round the corner (left out the door then left gain in about 30 mtrs) if you don't want to go further afield. Botin and Cafe l'Opera (both proper restaurants) are good bets for groups. The latter is more expensive but you can't fail to be bowled over by the semi-professional opera singers that entertain through the evening!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: angmc2
Reviews.Content: Just come back after 3 nights in this hotel, and already thinking about returning! Hotel has a superb location - you're close to everything you could need. We were able to stroll to Royal Palace, Sol, Plaza Mayor and Gran Via, with no effort at all! The staff are exceptionally friendly and helpful, and spoke great english, for which we were really grateful. Our room was completely clean and well equipped. We had no window view ( only onto a grim internal courtyard) but if we had wanted this we would have paid much extra in the first place. The en-suite bathroom was very modern and hi-tech, with a massage shower and lots of glass and mirrors. The only completely wierd thing was the glass doors to the bathroom - granted, they were partially frosted, but there was a 50cm square unfrosted part right by the toilet!!! So you could sit in bed and watch your partner on the toilet!!! Next time we will be taking a sheet of paper and some blu-tack! We could hear noise from the corridor, but I must say that this was due to other inconsiderate and selfish residents. The basement where the dining room is, is made to look like an old wine cellar, with its lovely curving walls and ceilings. We didn't take the breakfast option. There is a small seating area in the foyer which has a kind of waterfall down the wall, which is relaxing. The internet access is also free. We will be returning in the very near future! Brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was really clean and modern. Our room was fine, a little small but with a big bathroom and hydro shower. Location was perfect, 2 min walk from the Plaza Mayor which is beautiful at night as well as being close to the royal palace. Metro right at the end of the street which we used to get to the airport on the way home, the ticket cost 1 euro! In a really bustly part of town and is perfect for sightseeing, but the rooms were still quiet and cleaned everyday! Would use again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: autotim
Reviews.Content: The location is superb. Everything is within a 15min walk. Further up the road (2mins) towards Plaza Del Sol is another Petit Palace - I would try that next time. Arenal was pretty good for the price. The hotel is targeted at travellers in their 30's and young families. The staff is young, they offer free internet services and internal 'social' areas. Staff were friendly and good English speakers. I didn't notice any noise from outside the hotel. I did however hear people chatting away in the social areas the hotel has created. The room was a little tatty and unclean. The bedsheet covers were stained, the shower unclean (bits of red stuff on the shower wall) and some paint was peeling. I wouldn't like to see the results of an Ecoli test on some of those bathroom surfaces. However, I would stay there again. I figured I just got an unclean room and that happens a lot in hotels. For the price, it was pretty good, but I'll travel with disinfectant next time - just in case.

HotelInfo.Name: High Tech Petit Palace Arenal
HotelInfo.Address: Calle Arenal 16 | Puerta del Sol And Mayor Square, 28013 Madrid, Spain
